Executing Agency (Client):
Chamber of Commerce and Industry of the Republic of Armenia
11 Khanjyan Street
Yerevan 0010
Republic of Armenia

ADDRESS_NOT_STRUCT.ORGANISATION: Chamber of Commerce and Industry of the Republic of Armenia

CONTENTS.P: Project Description:

The Chamber of Commerce and Industry of the Republic of Armenia (the Client) has requested the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (the EBRD or the Bank) to provide technical assistance for “Support to the Chamber of Commerce and Industry in digitising Certificates of Origin for exporters” (the Project). The project will be delivered in 4 phases:
(i) Study of international best practice & e-platform design;
(ii) Development of Technical Requirements;
(iii) Development, testing and roll-out of eplatform;
(iv) Maintenance of e-platform.
Assignment Description:

The Client now intends to engage 2 economic experts or a firm (the 'Consultant') to assist the CCI in the phase 1 with economic expertise in agriculture/manufacturing and the provision of the certificates of origin (the 'Assignment'). The tasks of the Consultant will include, inter alia, the following:
— research the specifics of the regulations related to the production and export of agricultural (Consultant 1) and manufacturing (or other industrial activity) products (Consultant 2) in Armenia,
— research the specifics of the current procedures for providing Certificate of Origin for agricultural (Consultant 1) and manufacturing products (Consultant 2) to be exported from Armenia,
— analyse international best practice on digitalization of certificates of origin and creation of the respective online portal for certificate issuance,
— design optimization of the respective business processes in line with the.
International best practice within the Armenian context.
Status of Selection Process: Interested individual experts or firms are hereby invited to submit expressions of interest.
Assignment Start Date and Duration: The Project is expected to start in March 2018 and has an estimated overall duration of 34 months. The current assignment has the following timeline:
— 2 months for the analysis of international best practice in e-certification of Certificates of Origin,

— 2 months for drafting the report and designing a system to apply this international best practice in the Armenian context. This work will be undertaken in close collaboration between the 2 consultants to produce a single, integrated report at the end of the assignment proposing the design for a system to cover both agricultural and manufacturing roducts exported from Armenia.
Cost Estimate for the Assignment: 20,000 EUR (EUR 10,000 per consultant) (exclusive of VAT).

The Consultant must determine whether any indirect taxes/VAT are chargeable on the proposed services and state the basis for such. If any indirect taxes / VAT are payable, the Client will have to pay indirect taxes/VAT element to the services directly to the Consultant unless otherwise agreed.
Funding Source: It is anticipated that the contract will be financed by the EBRD Shareholder Special Fund Selection and contracting is subject to the availability of funding.
Eligibility: There are no eligibility restrictions based on consultant's country of origin.
Consultant Profile:

Individual services are required. Consultants 1 and 2 need to be experts (individual experts or a firm with expertise in both agricultural and manufacturing fields) with preferably the following qualifications, experience and competences:
— background in economics or related field, with preferably at least one postgraduate qualification,

— preferably 5 years of previous professional experience including examining the specific procedures for providing Certificate of Origin for agricultural products and recommending a system for implementation within the Armenian context (Consultant 1),

— preferably 5 years of previous professional experience including examining the specific rocedures for providing Certificate of Origin for manufacturing products and recommending a system for implementation within the Armenian context (Consultant 2),
— experience of working with government organizations will be an asset,
— good understanding of the process of economic reform in Armenia,
— analytical skills, with the ability to interpret and report on complex issues,
— ability to work effectively in a team,
— excellent knowledge of written and spoken English and Armenian.
Submission Requirements: In order to determine the capability and experience of Consultants seeking to be shortlisted, the information submitted should include the following:
1. Cover letter (maximum 2 pages) summarizing how the expert believes he / she satisfies the requirements as defined above under Consultant Profile;

2. CV (not exceeding 4 pages) which should include full descriptions of responsibilities carried out, not just a job title, including information on contracting entity/client, project location/country, duration (mm/yy to mm/yy), expert months provided (if different from duration), main activities, objectives;
3. Completed Consultant Declaration Form and Contact Sheet, the template for which is available from the following web-link:
http://www.ebrd.com/pages/workingwithus/procurement/notices/csu/contact_sheet.doc.

The complete expression of interest (including CVs, Consultant Declaration and Contact Sheet) should be submitted, in English via email (pdf) to the Client’s contact person, to reach the Client not later than the closing date. The expression of interest shall be one file (pdf). The Client reserves the right to reject applications of consultants submitting more than one file for the same assignment. Only if any limitation on the permissible file size is exceeded, the Consultant may split the expression of interest into further files.
Important Notes:
1. Following this invitation for expressions of interest, a shortlist of up to the 6 highestranked consultants and/or firms will be formally invited to attend an interview.
2. The shortlist criteria are as follows:
a. Professional experience in examining procedures in the agricultural sectors (Consultant 1) 15 %
A*. Professional experience in manufacturing sector (Consultant 2) 15 %
b. Professional experience at senior level, preferably both in the public and private sectors 10 %
c. Experience of working with government organizations 10 %
d. Understanding of the process of economic reform in Armenia 15 %
e. Analytical skills, with the ability to interpret and report on complex issues 10 %
f. Ability to work effectively in a team 5 %
g. Ability to prioritize and work under the pressure of deadlines 5 %
h. Language skills 10 %
i. Interview 20 %

The Client (CCI) will consult with the consultant regarding the format (e.g. skype call, meeting, conference call, etc.) and date of the interview at the time of the invitation. Please note that all and any costs incurred by the Consultant in connection with attendance to interviews will not reimbursed by the Client. The highest-ranked Consultant will be selected from a shortlist and be invited to negotiate the contract, subject to availability of funding.

CONTENTS.P: Project Description:

The Chamber of Commerce and Industry of the Republic of Armenia (the Client) has requested the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (the EBRD or the Bank) to provide technical assistance for “Support to the Chamber of Commerce and Industry in digitising Certificates of Origin for exporters” (the Project). The project will be delivered in 4 phases:
(i) Study of international best practice & e-platform design;
(ii) Development of Technical Requirements;
(iii) Development, testing and roll-out of eplatform;
(iv) Maintenance of e-platform.
Assignment Description:

The Client now intends to engage 2 economic experts or a firm (the 'Consultant') to assist the CCI in the phase 1 with economic expertise in agriculture/manufacturing and the provision of the certificates of origin (the 'Assignment'). The tasks of the Consultant will include, inter alia, the following:
— research the specifics of the regulations related to the production and export of agricultural (Consultant 1) and manufacturing (or other industrial activity) products (Consultant 2) in Armenia,
— research the specifics of the current procedures for providing Certificate of Origin for agricultural (Consultant 1) and manufacturing products (Consultant 2) to be exported from Armenia,
— analyse international best practice on digitalization of certificates of origin and creation of the respective online portal for certificate issuance,
— design optimization of the respective business processes in line with the.
International best practice within the Armenian context.
Status of Selection Process: Interested individual experts or firms are hereby invited to submit expressions of interest.
Assignment Start Date and Duration: The Project is expected to start in March 2018 and has an estimated overall duration of 34 months. The current assignment has the following timeline:
— 2 months for the analysis of international best practice in e-certification of Certificates of Origin,

— 2 months for drafting the report and designing a system to apply this international best practice in the Armenian context. This work will be undertaken in close collaboration between the 2 consultants to produce a single, integrated report at the end of the assignment proposing the design for a system to cover both agricultural and manufacturing roducts exported from Armenia.
Cost Estimate for the Assignment: 20,000 EUR (EUR 10,000 per consultant) (exclusive of VAT).

The Consultant must determine whether any indirect taxes/VAT are chargeable on the proposed services and state the basis for such. If any indirect taxes / VAT are payable, the Client will have to pay indirect taxes/VAT element to the services directly to the Consultant unless otherwise agreed.
Funding Source: It is anticipated that the contract will be financed by the EBRD Shareholder Special Fund Selection and contracting is subject to the availability of funding.
Eligibility: There are no eligibility restrictions based on consultant's country of origin.
Consultant Profile:

Individual services are required. Consultants 1 and 2 need to be experts (individual experts or a firm with expertise in both agricultural and manufacturing fields) with preferably the following qualifications, experience and competences:
— background in economics or related field, with preferably at least one postgraduate qualification,

— preferably 5 years of previous professional experience including examining the specific procedures for providing Certificate of Origin for agricultural products and recommending a system for implementation within the Armenian context (Consultant 1),

— preferably 5 years of previous professional experience including examining the specific rocedures for providing Certificate of Origin for manufacturing products and recommending a system for implementation within the Armenian context (Consultant 2),
— experience of working with government organizations will be an asset,
— good understanding of the process of economic reform in Armenia,
— analytical skills, with the ability to interpret and report on complex issues,
— ability to work effectively in a team,
— excellent knowledge of written and spoken English and Armenian.
Submission Requirements: In order to determine the capability and experience of Consultants seeking to be shortlisted, the information submitted should include the following:
1. Cover letter (maximum 2 pages) summarizing how the expert believes he / she satisfies the requirements as defined above under Consultant Profile;

2. CV (not exceeding 4 pages) which should include full descriptions of responsibilities carried out, not just a job title, including information on contracting entity/client, project location/country, duration (mm/yy to mm/yy), expert months provided (if different from duration), main activities, objectives;
3. Completed Consultant Declaration Form and Contact Sheet, the template for which is available from the following web-link:
http://www.ebrd.com/pages/workingwithus/procurement/notices/csu/contact_sheet.doc.

The complete expression of interest (including CVs, Consultant Declaration and Contact Sheet) should be submitted, in English via email (pdf) to the Client’s contact person, to reach the Client not later than the closing date. The expression of interest shall be one file (pdf). The Client reserves the right to reject applications of consultants submitting more than one file for the same assignment. Only if any limitation on the permissible file size is exceeded, the Consultant may split the expression of interest into further files.
